recipe.name: Green Rice With Jammy Eggs
recipe.description: A vibrant dish featuring crispy green rice infused with herbs and jalapeño, paired with jammy eggs, charred kale, and a hint of lime for a wholesome, flavorful meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: large bunch cilantro or parsley (or a mixture)
jalapeño, halved, seeds removed if desired
large bunch kale, chard, or other leafy greens
roasted salted peanuts or cashews, roughly chopped (optional)

steps: Roughly chop the cilantro, parsley, and scallions. Add to a food processor with jalapeño and garlic. Pulse until finely chopped but not a paste. Reserve 2 tablespoons of this mixture.
Combine the remaining herb mixture with cooked rice, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Toss to combine and set aside.
Bring a pot of water to a boil. Gently lower eggs into the pot and boil for 6–8 minutes for jammy yolks. Transfer eggs to ice water, then peel and halve.
Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add half the kale, season with salt and pepper, and cook until charred, about 5 minutes. Add remaining kale and cook until wilted. Remove and set aside.

Heat remaining olive oil in the same skillet. Add the rice mixture, pressing firmly with a spatula. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes until crisp on the bottom, then toss and cook for another 4–6 minutes.
Mix the rice with charred kale, lime zest, and juice. Toss in the reserved herb mixture. Top with halved eggs, nuts (if using), and serve with lime wedges.
Nothing beats homemade goodness—time to enjoy!
